greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of Pi^(2n)/(GAMMA(2n)*(1-2^(-2n))*Zeta(2n)); = 8*(highest power of 2 dividing n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Harvey Cohn, Some elementary aspects of modular functions in several variables, Bull. Amer. Math. Soc. 71 (1965), 681-704, (esp. p. 688).
maple: with(numtheory): for n from 1 to 200 do if n mod 2 = 1 then printf(`%d,`,8) else printf(`%d,`,8*2^ifactors(n)[2][1][2]) fi; od:
mathematica: a[n_] := 8*BitAnd[n, -n]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 81}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 20 2011, after _Joerg Arndt_ *)
program: (MAGMA) [2^(3 + Valuation(n,2)): n in [1..80]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 01 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jun 20 2000
